lines.text: The stiff, ehm, the deceased back there... Your brother, Mr. Franks?
Yes, it was.
I got a brudder.
Small world.
The scorpion.
One of nature's finest killers, Mr. Wint.
One is never too old to learn from a master, Mr. Kidd.
Right idea, Mr. Bond...
...But wrong pussy.
[after sealing Bond in a coffin and conveying him into a crematorium's furnace]
Very moving.
Heartwarming, Mr. Wint.
A glowing tribute, Mr. Kidd.
Tell me, Commander, how far does your expertise extend into the field of diamonds?
Well, hardest substance found in nature, they cut glass, suggests marriage, I suppose it replaced the dog as the girl's best friend. That's about it.
Refreshing to hear that there is one subject you're not an expert on!
[Tiffany Case opens the door almost nude]
That's quite a nice little nothing you're almost wearing. I approve.
I don't dress for the hired help. Let's see your passport, Franks.
[Bond gives her his passport. She looks it over]
Transport Consultant? It's a little cute isn't it? I'll finish dressing.
Oh, please don't, not on my account.
I give up. I know the diamonds are in the body, but where?
Alimentary, Dr. Leiter...
[Plenty O'Toole is thrown out of the window by some goons perhaps from the 10th floor, and lands in the middle of the hotel's swimming pool]

[looking down]
Exceptionally fine shot.
I didn't know there was a pool down there.
[a couple of oil workers open a hatch down to the oil pipe, and James Bond comes up to their surprise]
Thank you very much. I was just out walking my RAT and seem to have lost my way...
If at first you don't succeed Mr. Kidd...?
Try, try again, Mr. Wint.

The satellite is at present over... Kansas. Well, if we destroy Kansas the world may not hear about it for years. Perhaps New York, with all that smut and traffic... might give them a chance for a fresh start. Washington, DC. Perfect. Since we have not heard from them, *they* will hear from us.
Well, they're both aboard, and I must say Miss Case seems quite attractive...
[Mr. Wint glares at him]
...For a lady.
[pause]
Heh heh heh heh!
[to a rat]
Well, one of us smells like a tart's handkerchief.
[sniffs]
I'm afraid it's me. Sorry, old boy.
[Bond tastes the Mouton Rothschild wine served]
The wine is quite excellent. Although for such a grand meal I would have expected a claret.
But of course. Unfortunately our cellar is poorly stocked with clarets.
Mouton Rothschild IS a claret. And, I've smelled that aftershave before, and both times - I've smelled a rat.
[Bond sees Saxby gunned down after trying to assassinate Willard Whyte]
Saxby!
Burt Saxby? Tell him he's fired!

[Plenty O'Toole enters Bond's hotel room]
Well, if you'd like to come in, Plenty.
Oh, how pretty, what a super place you have!
Mmm...
[Plenty kisses him; Bond unzips her purple satin dress and it falls from her, leaving her almost completely naked except for her purple high heels and her transparent pink panties]

[holding up a finger, moving back]
Just give me one second, lover.
[she walks into the bedroom]

[Bond picks up her dress and tosses it onto a couch. He turns on a lamp and finds a goon pointing a gun at him]
Good evening.
[other lights come on, revealing another goon, also pointing a gun at him]
Well, I'm afraid you've caught me with more than my hands up.

[being forced out of the bedroom by a third goon, her arms folded across her chest protectively]
Hey, what the hell is this? A pervert's convention or something?
[the other goons come over and pick her up, carrying her over to the window]
Now listen, you can't do this to me! Stop that! I've got friends in this town!
[she is thrown out of the window and lands in the pool]
Hi, I'm Plenty.
But of course you are.
Plenty O'Toole.
Named after your father perhaps?
[to Tiffany, as he turns the lights out and gets in bed with her]
Presumably I'm the condemned man and obviously you're the hearty breakfast.
[James Bond is lucky with the dice while gambling]
You handle those cubes like a monkey handles coconuts.
Good morning, gentlemen. ACME pollution inspection. We're cleaning up the world, we thought this was a suitable starting point.
Weren't you a blonde when I came in?
Could be.
I tend to notice little things like that - whether a girl is a blonde or a brunette.
Which do you prefer?
Well, as long as the collar and cuffs match.
We'll talk about that later.
Anyone seeing you in that outfit, Moneypenny, would most certainly be discouraged from leaving the country. What can I bring you back from Holland?
A diamond? In a ring?
Would you settle for a tulip?

[Bond leaves; she sighs longingly]
Yes!
[Plenty O'Toole is found face down in a swimming pool]
She's...
Dead. Supposed to be you. The next link in the "pipeline".
What are you talking about?
Poor Plenty must have stumbled in here looking for you.
I don't believe you!
A dentist is dead in South Africa. That little old lady in Amsterdam. Shady got his last night. They've missed me once. And you're next. Now, who's your connection?
You sound like a cop to me...
[Slaps her]
Who's your connection?
All I know, his voice is on a phone. They got me this place and told me to wait for further instructions.
You'll find that rather difficult to hear underwater.
[last lines]
Oh, James.
Oh, yes. What were you about to ask me?
James, how the hell do we get those diamonds down again?
Well go on, go on, it's merely a lift. Or should I say elevator? In any event I'm sure you'll find it far more convenient than mountaineering about outside the Whyte House.

[while Q is playing the slot machines, winning big every time]
Hi there, Mr. Q. Are you having any luck?
I'm being somewhat successful, thank you.

[reading Bond's ID card planted on the deceased Franks]
My God! You just killed James Bond!
Is that who it was? Well just goes to show, no one's indestructible.
Go blow up your pants!

[playing craps]
I'll take the full odds on the ten, two hundred on the hard way, the limit on all the numbers, two hundred and fifty on the eleven. Thank you very much.
Say, you played this game before.
Just once.
Tiffany Case? Definitely distinctive.
I was born there, on the first floor, while my mother was looking for a wedding ring.
Well, I'm glad for your sake it wasn't Van Cleef & Arpels.
If God had wanted man to fly...
...He would have given him wings, Mr. Kidd.
Curious... how everyone who touches those diamonds seems to die.
Tiffany, my dear. We're showing a bit more *cheek* than usual, aren't we?
[Tiffany takes the cassette out from her bottom and hands it to Blofeld]

[to the guards]
Take her below and lock her up with Mr. Bond.
[the guards take her to a cell]
What a pity, such nice cheeks too. If only they were brains.
[referring to the cassette]
Destroy this, Metz.
[Bond has shoved a tape in the rear end of Tiffany's bikini bottom]
Bitch. Your problems are all behind you now.
We do function in your absence, Commander.
You have been on holiday, I understand. Relaxing, I hope?
Oh, hardly relaxing, but most satisfying.
Listen, you can drop me off at the next corner. This whole thing is getting a little out of hand. No regrets, but when you start stealing moon machines from Willard Whyte, GOOD bye and GOOD Luck!
Just relax, I have a friend named Felix who can fix anything.
Is he married?
[after being pulled over by the sherriff]

[sarcastically]
Relax, you've got a friend named Felix who can fix anything.
Unfortunately, so can Willard Whyte.
[first lines]

[tossing Japanese man around]
Where is he? I shan't ask you politely next time. Where is Blofeld?
Ca-Ca-Cairo.
Making mud pies, 007?
What do you intend to do with those diamonds?
An excellent question. And one which will be hanging on the lips of the world quite soon. If I were to break the news to anyone it would be to you first, Mr Bond, you know that.
Good evening, Mr Bond.
Blofeld?
Good evening, 007.
Double jeopardy, Mr Bond.
You killed my only other double, I'm afraid. After his death, volunteers were understandably... rather scarce.
Such a pity. All that time and energy wasted, simply to provide you with one mock, heroic moment.
Baja? I haven't got anything in Baja!

[to James Bond]
You dirty double-crossing limey fink! Those goddamn diamonds are phonies!
Surely, sir, there's no need to involve our section on a relatively simple smuggling matter.
Sir Donald has convinced the PM otherwise. May I remind you 007, that Blofeld is dead. Finished! The least we can expect from you now is a little *plain*, *solid*, *work*.
Darling, why are we suddenly staying in the Bridal Suite at the Whyte House?
In order to form a more perfect union, sweetheart.

[seductively]
I'm "Bambi."
And I am "Thumper." Is there something we can do for you?
I can think of several things, off hand...
[as Bond, still incognito as Peter Franks, removes his underwear to seduce Tiffany]
Why, Peter, there's much more to you than I imagined!
Who are you?
My name is Bond, James Bond.
Is there something I can do for you?
Yes, as a matter of fact, there is. There's something I'd like you to get off your chest.
[Pulls off her bikini top and wraps it around her neck]
Where is Ernst Stavro Blofeld? Speak up, darling, I can't hear you.
Well, well, well, look what the cat dragged in.
Welcome to Hell, Blofeld.
Well, that's a neat trick.
I see you've met my friends Bambi and Thumper
Keep leaning on that tooter, Charlie, and you're gonna get a shot in the mouth.
Klaus Hergersheimer, checking radation badges... Klaus Hergersheimer... checking radiation badges?
Mr. Franks? I'm Morton Slumber. Please accept my heartfelt condolences at this most difficult hour

[as Peter Franks]
Well, he is heading for a better world, Mr. Slumber. There's some consolation in that.
Now then, if we're ready to begin the final journey...
[actives control panel]
[Ethereal music rises, curtains part, and the casket travels on a short conveyer through a small hatchway into the cremation furnace]

[cutting off music abruptly]
Ah- May his soul rest in peace.
Oh, yes... yes, Amen.

Now if you would care to follow me into my comfortable office Mr. Franks, we will bring you the urn... Oh, I'm so happy you chose our Half-couch Hinge-panel Slumber-on Casket. I'm sure your brother would have appreciated it
Oh, I'm sure he did.
[a knock on the door; Mr. Wint and Mr. Kidd, posing as host and a steward, brings into the couple's suite a romantic dinner]

[puzzled]
There must be some mistake. I didn't order any...
Oysters Andaluz, Shashlik, Tidbits, Prime rib au jus, Salade Utopia...
[Mr. Kidd sets the timer for the bomb in the fake La Bombe Surprise]
...and for dessert, the piece de resistance...
[Mr. Kidd shows the fake dessert]
La Bombe Surprise.
Mmm! That's looks fantastic. What's in it?
Ah, but then there would be no surprise, Madame.
Star of South Africa. 83.5 carats rough. 47.5 carats cut. The Akbar Shah. 116 carats rough. Are you paying attention 007?
The Akbar Shah. 116 carats rough.

[Bond, posing as Peter Franks, calling on an intercom]
Yes?
Franks, Peter Franks.
Come up, third floor.
Is he dead?
I sincerely hope so.
Well, that's it, pussycat. I shot the whole wad. What do you say? Back to my place?
You're a nice person, Maxie. Really, you are. Why don't you go and take a nap and I'll see you next year.
Sorry about your fulsome friend. I bet you really missed something.
Well, the evening may not be a total loss, after all.
Why don't we talk a bit first.
Well, what would like to talk about?
You pick a subject.
Diamonds.
Felix, if she gives your men the slip...
Relax, I've got upwards of 30 agents down there. A mouse with sneakers on couldn't get through.

Here, for the first time, see Zambora. Strangest girl ever born to live. She was captured near Nairobi, South Africa. And is believed to be of a cruel, inhuman experiment. This beautiful girl will be locked into a steel cage, right in front of your eyes, will change very slowly into a ferocious 450 pound gorilla.
How do you like me so far? People say I have the body of Rock Hudson. If he ever finds out what I'm doin' to it - he'll be madder than hell.
I tried to phone him. Trying to find Willard White is like trying to find a virgin in a maternity ward.
Nice place you have here. Take something off. Enjoy the sun.
You've got a lot of guts showing up here! After letting me freeze my behind off at a blackjack table for two hours waiting for some nonexistent diamonds!
There goes that son of a bitchin' saboteur!
Miss Tiffany Case *Jones* has a lifetime reservation at another hotel - the kind the government - runs.
I cooperating, Mr. Leiter, really I am.
Oh, I can vouch for that!
And, eh, that's all there is to it?
Not quite. First, we're going to have a ball!
[Knees Bond in the crotch]
Mr. Whyte, phone call for you from Washington. Urgent.
I'll catch it in the john.
What if they won't accept our ultimatum? What if they decide to attack?
Calm yourself, Metz. This farcical show of force was only to be expected. Great powers flexing their military muscles like so many impudent beach boys.

How disappointing. I was expecting one head of state, at the very least. Surely you haven't come to negotiate, Mr. Bond. Your pitiful little island hasn't even been threatened. Search him from his toe nails to the last follicle on his head and then bring him to me.
I'm so sorry to have ruined the line of your suit for nothing.
Talking about lines, which one did you use on Miss Case?
Miss Case has taken a terribly *reasonable* attitude about all this. Like any sensible animal, she's only threatening when she's threatened.
It appears that you're holding all the aces - right down to the dragon lady, over here.
Jealousy? From you, Mr. Bond? I'm flattered.

[to Bond]
As La Rochefoucauld observed, "humility is the worst form of conceit." I do hold the winning hand. Why don't you let me take you on a little tour of our facilities. Your chance to see the real tape once again.
Can I tag along Ernst?
I'd put something on over that bikini, first, my dear. I've come to far to have the aim of my crew affected by the sight of a pretty body.
Pity about your liver, sir. Unusually fine Solera. '51, I believe.
There is no year for sherry, 007.
I was referring to the original vintage on which the sherry is based, sir. 1851, unmistakable.
Precisely.
You press "L" Mr. Bond, the word "Lobby" begins with "L".
